Def.Name: European White Birch
Def.Description: Medium tree, growing to 50' - 80' tall. Slender trunk usually under 16" in diameter.
Def.Leaves: 1 1/2" - 3" long, triangular with a broad base and pointed tip, coarsely double toothed often lobed.
Def.Twigs: Red-brown with tiny, resin bearing glands and shiny, resinous buds.
Def.Bark: Very clean looking, flaky and white.
Def.Range: Hardy to Zone 3a. Its range extends into southwest Asia in the mountains of northern Turkey and the Caucasus.
Def.Remarks: Silver Birch is Finland's national tree.
